title: Differential Expression Analysis
text: vignette, ’ll replicate portion example differential expression analysis Harvard Chan Bioinformatics Core, using data Kenny, et al.. package comes filtered version data set (genes average less 2 counts per million across samples filtered ), called mov10. , ’ll set differential expression analysis compares Mov10 Overexpression samples (high_1, etc.) control samples (control_1, etc.).

title: Differential Expression Analysis
text: represent experimental design model matrix. Since ’re focusing single treatment condition (Mov10 Overexpression), just two-column matrix.
code: # the first three samples are in the treatment condition mov10_overexpression <- c(1, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0) X_g <- model.matrix(~mov10_overexpression) print(X_g) #>   (Intercept) mov10_overexpression #> 1           1                    1 #> 2           1                    1 #> 3           1                    1 #> 4           1                    0 #> 5           1                    0 #> 6           1                    0 #> attr(,"assign") #> [1] 0 1

title: Differential Expression Analysis
text: want test sharp null hypotheses (.e. literally difference expression treatment control gene gg), need identify model parameters associated sharp null hypotheses model uses mixture prior parameters. indicator vector: order corresponds order columns model matrix. interested testing whether log-scale intercept exactly 0, first element mixture_probabilities 0 - model use mixture prior intercept. Since like test H0g:difference expression level treatment control gene g, H_0^g: \text{difference expression level treatment control gene } g,  use mixture prior parameter associated second column model matrix - parameter represents difference (log) expression level treatment control.

title: Differential Expression Analysis
code: args <- list(   y = as.matrix(mov10[, 4:ncol(mov10)]), # don't want geneid   G = nrow(mov10), # number of genes / tags   X_g = X_g,   Z_g = matrix(data = numeric(), ncol = 0),   mixture_probabilities = mixture_probabilities )

title: Differential Expression Analysis
text: aside, model huge take long time sample. access computing cluster, recommend setting model fitting analysis pipeline run cluster. See vignette "Computational costs" information minimize model sampling time use alternatives MCMC sampling.

title: Differential Expression Analysis
Authors and Citation
text: David Cannon Walker. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Walker DC (2025). ngstan: Stan models NGS data. R package version 0.0.1, https://dcannonwalker.github.io/ngstan/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ngstan: Stan models for NGS data},   author = {David Cannon Walker},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://dcannonwalker.github.io/ngstan/}, }

title: Stan models for NGS data
text: ngstan provides Stan implementations statistical models analysis Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) data. ngstan uses cmdstanr instantiate packages provide pre-compiled Stan models can fit using variety sampling algorithms available cmdstanr (e.g. ADVI Pathfinder), addition NUTS sampler.

title: Stan models for NGS data
text: ngstan package depends R package CmdStanR command line tool CmdStan, important follow steps order: Install R package CmdStanR. CmdStanR CRAN, recommended way install install.packages("cmdstanr", repos = c("https://mc-stan.org/r-packages/", getOption("repos"))). Optional: set environment variables CMDSTAN_INSTALL /CMDSTAN manage CmdStan installation. Install ngstan using R command .

text: standata data list updated a_sig2 vector shape parameters Inverse Gamma priors `sig2` b_sig2 vector scale parameters Inverse Gamma priors `sig2` a_sig2_mu vector shape parameters Inverse Gamma priors `sig2_mu` b_sig2_mu vector scale parameters Inverse Gamma priors `sig2_mu` a_mu_offset vector shape parameters Inverse Gamma priors `mu_offset` b_mu_offset vector scale parameters Inverse Gamma priors `mu_offset` a_sig2_offset vector shape parameters Inverse Gamma priors `sig2_offset` b_sig2_offset vector scale parameters Inverse Gamma priors `sig2_offset` a_sig2_u vector shape parameters Inverse Gamma priors `sig2_u` b_sig2_u vector scale parameters Inverse Gamma priors `sig2_u` beta_phi_prior 2-vector giving location scale parameters prior distribution `beta_phi` A_S location parameter `S_PARAM` `!normfactors_known` B_S scale parameter `S_PARAM` `!normfactors_known` S_DATA Numeric vector normalization factors sample; optional, `NULL` `normfactors_known == TRUE`, normalization factors estimated `TMM` method described `edgeR` package normfactors_known Use fixed normalization factors extrinsic model? use_neg_binomial_response Use negative binomial distribution instead Poisson errors?
